decision_conditions: The operations come within the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class E of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, thereby not requiring planning permission.

The operations come within the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class F of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, thereby not requiring planning permission.

It should be noted that the large cedar tree to the front boundary facing Parkstone Avenue is protected by a Tree Preservation Order (TPO 34/90). The applicant should seek advise from the Council's Arboricultural Officer before undertaken any works on site, as separate planning consent may be required.

This certificate provides confirmation that the development is lawful.  You should also check whether the development requires separate Building Regulation consent. Information is available on the Building Control webpages via http://www.havering.gov.uk/Pages/Category/Building-control.aspx?l1=200252 and the team is available between 9am and 10am Monday to Friday via 01708 432700.

Please note that this certificate is granted for the outbuilding to be used as a garage/storage shed as described on the application form. It must only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of 68 Parkstone Avenue, Horrnchurch and not for any trade or business nor as living accommodation. Should business or living accommodation use be intended, an application for full planning permission must be applied for and permission granted before such use could occur. The use of outbuildings as living accommodation is not typically deemed acceptable therefore it is important the outbuilding is only used for the purposes as listed above.
description: DOUBLE GARAGE AT END OF GARDEN WITH A DRIVEWAY FROM THE FRONT BOUNDARY
